entry.title: Disable lacros.CompareVersionWithAsh on chrome build
entry.content:
lacros.CompareVersionWithAsh which was promoted to critical recently is

consistently failing on multiple chrome builds.

The cl to promote it to critical was reverted on chromeos repo, but we

won't have LKGM for at least next 3 versions (15520.0.0 - 15522.0.0) due

to release-main-orchestorator failures, so it will take a while for

chromium to get the tast-test repo's change.

Therefore, we disable the test inside tast_control.gni meanwhile, and

wait for the new LKGM to be applied.

entry.title: Fix false assumption about VmObservers in LockToSingleUserManagerTest
entry.content:
Currently, LockToSingleUserManagerTest's StartPluginVm() and

StartConciergeVm() check the number of ConciergeClient::VmObserver, and

call LockToSingleUserManager::OnVmStarting() if the number is positive.



However, it is incorrect in two ways:

1) OnVmStarting() is not necessarily called when Concierge's VM is

started.

2) It behaves correctly only when there is no VmObservers other than

LockToSingleUserManager. When there is another VmObserver,

OnVmStarting() is called and the device is locked to a single user

even if LockToSingleUserManager itself does not observe VM events.

We saw this wrong behavior in PS1 of CL:4653753.



To fix the behavior, this CL makes StartPluginVm() and

StartConciergeVm() call PluginVmManager::LaunchPluginVm() and

FakeConciergeClient::NotifyVmStarted(), respectively.

This way, LockToSingleUserManager's OnVmStarting() and OnVmStarted() are

called only when LockToSingleUserManager is observing VM events.

ScopedFeatureList, ChromeShelfController, and a bunch of D-Bus clients

are set up to allow PluginVmManager::LaunchPluginVm() to succeed without

a crash.



Also, currently the device's lock state is almost always checked only in

CryptohomeMiscClient. This CL adds checks in SessionTerminationManager

as well. For this, RunUntilIdle() is added to LoginUser() and StartArc()

to ensure that the lock state is updated in SessionTerminationManager.



UnexpectedVmStartLockTest is removed since it seems to be doing

practically the same thing as ConciergeStartLockTest.



Bug: None

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="LockToSingleUserManagerTest.*"



Change-Id: I54ca95643ff2cdfa35850720f2bdb7177af2ac2c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4654082

Reviewed-by: Victor-Gabriel Savu

Commit-Queue: Youkichi Hosoi

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1164054}

entry.title: Fix a SigninDataCounter crash
entry.content:
SigninDataCounter sometimes crashes when handling a callback in the idle

state, which could happen if it's restarted multiple times. The first

restart causes a callback that has the counter return a response and get

to an idle state. The second callback then arrives in an idle state,

which hits a NOTREACHED() in the base class BrowsingDataCounter.



This CL invalidates background tasks when the counters are reset.



Bug: 1454588

entry.title: Fix flaky test and batch BidirectionalStreamTest
entry.content:
The flaky test was doing the following

1. Disable autoAdvance to make sure we handle callbacks manually.

2. Setup a stream

3. Send all of the write data before reading anything. [The server will echo those back to the client, so the test can expect to read the same strings again.]

4. Invoke a single read (This was the result of flakiness, when you invoke a single read, there is no guarantee that you will read the whole string because it might still be in flight.

The test always assumed that a single read will guarantee that the server has echoed everything back but sometimes there was a race where only a prefix was sent back.)



The resulting error looked like this:

expected to start with: abbcccTest String1234567890woot!

but was : abbcccTest String



Bug: 1458845

Change-Id: I23aae7dd780daaec0baf37b85526b535a042be79

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4656582

Commit-Queue: Mohannad Farrag

Reviewed-by: Stefano Duo

Commit-Queue: Stefano Duo

entry.title: Remove duplicate includes of remoting file_transfer files
entry.content:
There were a few files that were directly added as sources to both

//remoting/host/file_transfer and

//remoting/host/file_transfer:test_support, which leads to linker issues

('duplicate symbol') when trying to write unittests that depend on

`file_transfer`.

These files are:

* "directory_helpers.cc",

* "ensure_user_no_op.cc",

* "file_chooser_chromeos.cc",



This causes the Windows build to use the real implementations of

EnsureUserContext() and GetFileUploadDirectory() during unittests,

so I had to change the ipc unittests to use a FakeFileOperations

(since the LocalFileOperations it previously used relied on

EnsureUserContext and GetFileUploadDirectory being faked on Windows).



Change-Id: I93344945750f36762f7eab38adcb2c18119f6923

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4624103

Reviewed-by: Joe Downing

Commit-Queue: Jeroen Dhollander

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1164021}

entry.title: Reland "Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ed327f258e490c32e40fa5241a9dd39950827180.



Reason for revert: The CL was suspected to be the cause of failures on certain builders, so it was reverted. It wasn't the cause, so

relanding.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files"

>

> This reverts commit d38fe2383a12431dc573c5a9948ea12156bb332c.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspecting of breaking MetricsServiceBrowserTest.CheckCrashRenderers

> in Linux CFI.

>

> First failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25500/test-results

>

> Original change's description:

> > Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files

> >

> > This also adds a "clean exit" bit in the PMA files. So it's easier to

> > tell if a PMA file being read comes from a crashed session. This is not perfect since it's still possible for the device or browser to

> > crash after this bit is set. In any case, in practice this should be

> > fine? (Only used to help investigate crash dumps).

> >

> > Also updates the "kGlobalVersion" so that we know how old a PMA file

> > is in the crash reports (i.e., whether the file comes from a version

> > before or after the introduction of this "clean exit" bit).

> >

> > In persistent_memory_allocator.cc, there was also a check that if

> > a PersistentMemoryAllocator is instantiated with memory that already

> > exists, and the "version" doesn't match, then it is set to corrupt.

> > I modified this CHECK because that's not quite accurate, since changes

> > may be made in a backwards-compatible way.

> >

> > Bug: 1432981

> > Change-Id: If72a2f1ed94a7d6d08a832123929aeeaef042541

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4621128

> > Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

> > Commit-Queue: Luc Nguyen

> > Reviewed-by: Colin Blundell

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1163044}

>

> Bug: 1432981

> Change-Id: I2b5d5f3ff52f745d943634f5d110e42d641efcbd

> No-Presubmit: true

> No-Tree-Checks: true

> No-Try: true

This enables the first bytes of Rust in the Chromium binary itself

for ChromeOS. It simply enables a chrome://crash/rust URI handler

which users should not normally encounter.



We're enabling this carefully and progressively across platforms.



This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4624431

which was reverted because parts of Chrome OS are still on python

3.6 and one of our Rust build scripts required Python 3.7.



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647335

removes the dependency on Python 3.7 and will land before this

relanding CL.

entry.title: [Android][Autofill] Encapsulate error messages in field validator.
entry.content:
Field model supports following error messages:

* custom_error_message - message to show immediately after editor

is opened, this error message gets reset after the first edit to the

field.

* invalid_error_message - message to show when field value doesn't

pass validation.

* required_error_message - message to show when field is empty

and it is required.



All these properties do not directly affect the field's state, the

only relevant property is the resulting error message computed during

field validation.



This CL reduces the size of the field's model by using only 1 error

message, which should be immediately shown to the user. All other

error message strings are encapsulated in the EditorFieldValidator.



Bug: 1435314

entry.title: [dPWA] Replace SetSubsystems() with SetProvider()
entry.content:
This CL replaces the SetSubsystems() idiom with SetProvider() in

most web app manager classes.



SetSubsystems() was originally designed for unit tests to create

an individual manager class and just its dependencies for testing.

Our unit testing philosophy has since changed, instead we prefer

test the full web app system with external dependencies (e.g.

WebContents) mocked out rather than testing individual classes.



By using SetProvider() many dangling raw_ptrs are removed from

the web app codebase.



Bug: b/283816014

entry.title: Add density metric for WebP still images
entry.content:
This CL is the WebP version of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4626160.



The original Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.KiBWeighted histogram was

added by Alex Deymo in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3257406, and

removed by Moritz Firsching in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4548468 after

it expired.



In bringing back the histogram, I made the following changes:

1. Add "2" to the histogram name so we don't mix the data with the old

Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.KiBWeighted data.

2. It is recorded only for still images, not for animated images.

Note: We probably should also exclude images with alpha from this

histogram.



Bug: 1456182

entry.title: Introduce two NetworkContext methods for managing shared dictionaries
entry.content:
This CL introduces two methods in `NetworkContext` for managing shared

dictionaries:

* `GetSharedDictionaryUsageInfo()`: This method returns information

about the stored shared dictionary usage.

* `ClearSharedDictionaryCacheForIsolationKey()`: This method clears

dictionaries which are registered for the specified isolation key.



These methods will be used to manage shared dictionaries from

`chrome://settings/content/all` and the Page Specific Site Data Dialog

(crbug.com/1413922#c59).

No actual metrics changes.

entry.title: Prerender UKM: Lifecycle check when AudioContextManager records UKMs
entry.content:
AudioContext creation is permitted even during the prerendering, but the

context should not start running even if the autoplay is permitted by

the policy. This restriction allows us to have a lifecycle CHECK in the

AudioContextManagerImpl as the manager is constructed when the context

starts running. This condition check is needed to record UKMs as the

data collection policy disallows collecting it while prerendering.

GetPageUkmSourceId() returns meaningless ID for such cases now, but it

would cause CHECK failure in the near future.



Bug: 1245014

Change-Id: Ia8529abae83fbff819f80f7de9f68170c484ef24

entry.title: Prerender UKM: PrefetchNetworkContext ensures lifecycle state
entry.content:
PrefetchNetworkContext calls GetPageUkmSourceId to pass it on

URLLoaderFactory creation. But the obtained ID is valid only when the

page is not in the prerendering state.

This condition is ensured as the prerendering page doesn't trigger any

prefetch request. This patch adds lifecycle CHECK to verify it.

entry.title: [win] Use top-level widget for fullscreen notification
entry.content:
On Windows, a topmost child window will be placed behind other topmost

windows when its parent gains focus. This is undesired for the

fullscreen notification, a security-related window, which was being

occluded by the PiP window under certain circumstances.



Fix this by showing fullscreen notification in a top-level widget.

entry.title: Prerender UKM: Clarify ukm::SourceId for ExtensionURLLoaderFactory
entry.content:
Currently, RenderFrameHost::GetPageUkmSourceId is called also for

prerendering frames, but it doesn't support the case and the returned

ID would not be associated with any URL.



This patch explicitly exclude the prerendering frames to calculate

the ukm::SourceIdObj, and use ukm::kInvalidSourceIdObj for prerendering.



Bug: 1245014

Change-Id: I484b7107548ba8d8dd56b26800b35a2171738700

entry.title: ios: Deflake BrandingViewControllerAlwaysVisibleTestCase.
entry.content:
BrandingViewControllerAlwaysVisibleTestCase has a custom implementation

of DismissKeyboard which can fail on iOS17 because of the new OOP

keyboard. Instead just use the default EG dismissKeyboard implementation

which just calls -resignFirstResponder.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Incorporate about page into main page container
entry.content:
Historically, the About page was handled specially: When the About page

is visible, all other pages are hidden. When other pages are visible,

the about page is hidden. This was implemented with unnecessarily

complex code, including using MainPageMixin for the About page.



This CL refactors the About page to be included in the main set of pages

like all other pages are. The mutually exclusive nature of the page

visibility is maintained.



Screen recordings:

OsSettingsRevampWayfinding enabled: http://shortn/_TbgV3S11Zd

OsSettingsRevampWayfinding disabled: http://shortn/_IQn7tYxu5Y



search results deep link to the correct settings/elements.



Bug: b/288582432, b/282154231

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="OSSettings*"

Test: Manually test about page can be initially loaded and related

Change-Id: I1a742a1e3ce168ccb6e114427fb2e1ff0f1dcb42

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4640948

entry.title: CR2023: Use shared variable for disabled colors and add HCM fallbacks
entry.content:
This CL consolidates all the commonly used fallback colors for

disabled state to shared vars and overrides the fallback colors for

high contrast mode. This will fix not being able to differentiate

enabled vs disabled elements in HCM for WebUIs that do not use the

color pipeline and rely on the fallback colors.



Bug: 1459089

entry.title: Remove Telemetry tests using Metal from Mac AMD Retina ASAN bot.
entry.content:
For some reason only on this specific hardware, when ANGLE's Metal

backend is used and with an ASAN build, the GPU process is crashing

upon startup. The same behavior hasn't been reproduced locally on a

GPU of similar family.



Temporarily remove the affected tests from "Mac FYI Retina ASAN (AMD)"

to get the bot green again until it's been possible to diagnose the

failures.



Bug: 1458020

entry.title: Adjust padding around CrOS touch selection handles.
entry.content:
Adjust padding of touch selection handles to mostly match Figma mocks

at go/next-e14s-touchtext. This padding is invisible and is used to

expand the targetable area of the touch handles to make them easier to

target.



At some point, it would probably be nice to extract the padding

constants (and other constants related to drawing the touch handles) to

ensure it is consistent between TouchHandleDrawableAura (used from web

content) and TouchSelectionControllerImpl (used from views). However,

the padding applied to TouchHandleDrawableAura is currently a bit

confusing since the TouchHandleDrawable interface is also shared with

the Android touch selection handles. For now, just add comments

clarifying some of the non-intuitive parts.



These changes are just planned for CrOS at the moment (maybe Desktop

Chrome later), keep it all behind a flag for now.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Add padding when textfield hovered.
entry.content:
In ChromeRefresh we need additional border space so that the hover

state has some padding between the edge of Textfield and the text.

We will match the horizontal hover insets to that of the

vector button and take this into account when calculating the

margins for the textfield. This gives us symmetry between the

left margin of the FindBarView which is lined up with the Textfield

and the right margin of the FindBarView which is lined up with

the close button.



This CL also renames layout provider variables for more clarify.

entry.title: Use VectorIcons with ColorId for aura touch selection handles.
entry.content:
Add vector icons for aura touch selection handles and add basic support

for following the color pipeline. For now, only use these under the CrOS

touch text editing redesign flag, but add the changes to the general

aura implementation so that it is easier to update other aura platforms

as well if it is later needed.



For TouchSelectionControllerImpl (used from views), the handles follow

the usual views color pipeline. For TouchHandleDrawableAura (used from

web content), we just make the handles follow the native theme, since it

seems a bit fiddly to get it to follow the color theme of the context

window at the moment.

that in followups.)

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3w9qzk2uP3kGSyY.png

(i.e. similar, just slightly bigger and supports dynamic color.)

entry.title: [Test Automation] Provide description for Check[Result]()
entry.content:
Since Check() and CheckResult() key off of a dummy element, it's not

clear which Check() has failed when a test sequence with multiple checks

fails.



This allows you to specify an optional "check description" string when

adding a Check() or CheckResult() step; this will be included in the

default description of the step.



This could also be achieved by calling

Check(....).SetDescription("My additional description") but this is

wordy and it's not clear that doing this is a best practice; by making

the description a parameter of the verb itself, we prompt test-writers

to fill it out.



Change-Id: Ice44c0bd6d50f2430205b3bfc67cdef1899d38d7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4652063

entry.title: [fuchsia] Start using a hermetic font server for tests
entry.content:
The hermetic font server comes with fonts bundled in, and does not

need the config-data route to work properly.



config-data is an old method of providing configuration to the font

server, which is less efficient than drawing the fonts from a

dedicated component.

entry.title: Fix hover card icon color change on system theme
entry.content:
Hover card tab alert icons were coded to match the icon color of that

in the tab strip. However, this makes the icons hard to see when there

is a mismatch in system theme and chrome theme. For example, if the

system is in light theme, but chrome uses a dark colored theme, the

icon will be white on a light gray background hover card. This CL fixes

this issue by having the hover card icon color to reflect what the

icons should icon should look like in light/dark system theme instead

of the customized chrome theme



Before fix: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/44vR9y7WfRsiT9b.png

After fix: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Se2Kzd4mhBp3PV.png



Fixed: 1453897
